data.name: Tropius
data.flavorText: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.

attacks.name: Attach Leaves
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Decidueye
data.flavorText: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye's shots never miss.

abilities.name: Deep Forest Camo
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX.

attacks.name: Splitting Arrow
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dhelmise V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Anchor Anger
attacks.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Giga Hammer
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer.

data.name: Dhelmise VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swinging Chain
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Max Anchor
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Max Anchor.

data.name: Zarude
data.flavorText: Once the vines on Zarude's body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.

attacks.name: Suctioning Vines
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Buizel
data.flavorText: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

data.name: Floatzel
data.flavorText: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

data.name: Manaphy
data.flavorText: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

abilities.name: Ocean Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal a Pokémon you find there, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Volcanion
data.flavorText: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

attacks.name: Dynamite Steam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 120 damage for each heads.

data.name: Cramorant
data.flavorText: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

attacks.name: Spit-Out Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Frosmoth
data.flavorText: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

abilities.name: Ice Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: One boy's invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotom's unique capabilities.

abilities.name: Roto Choice
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Item cards that have the word "Rotom" in their name, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Morpeko
data.flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

attacks.name: Famished
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Morpeko V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Electro Wheel
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Yanmega
data.flavorText: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Nosedive
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Celebi
data.flavorText: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.

abilities.name: Woodland Stroll
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal an Energy card you find there, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Reshiram
data.flavorText: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.

attacks.name: Amazing Blaze
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

data.name: Drednaw
data.flavorText: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Trapinch
data.flavorText: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.

attacks.name: Land's Pulse
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Spinarak
data.flavorText: Although the poison from its fangs isn't that strong, it's potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.

data.name: Crobat V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dark Asset
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. You can't use more than 1 Dark Asset Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Yanma
data.flavorText: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

data.name: Cacnea
data.flavorText: It prefers harsh environments such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.

abilities.name: Sky Circus
abilities.text: If you played Bird Keeper from your hand during this turn, ignore all Energy in this Pokémon's attack costs.

attacks.name: Wind Shard
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dartrix
data.flavorText: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.

data.name: Thwackey
data.flavorText: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

abilities.name: Lay of the Land
abilities.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Gossifleur
data.flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

data.name: Cinderace V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Field Runner
abilities.text: If a Stadium is in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Kyogre
data.flavorText: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

attacks.name: Amazing Surge
attacks.text: This attack does 80 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

attacks.name: Under Pressure
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

abilities.name: Top Entry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokémon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.

data.name: Morpeko VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Discharge
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Galarian Weezing
data.flavorText: This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.

abilities.name: Neutralizing Gas
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play have no Abilities, except for Neutralizing Gas.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon during Pokémon Checkup.

data.name: Grookey
data.flavorText: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Rillaboom
data.flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

abilities.name: Voltage Beat
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Eldegoss
data.flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

attacks.name: Enriching Seeds
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Cinderace VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

attacks.name: Max Pyro Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Chewtle
data.flavorText: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

data.name: Snom
data.flavorText: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Luxio during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Morpeko
data.flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

attacks.name: Famished
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Indeedee V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Watch Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Crobat VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stealth Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Ditto VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Transform
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Rusted Sword
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The attacks of the Zacian V this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Gym Trainer
rules: Draw 2 cards. If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Thievul
data.flavorText: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

attacks.name: Call for Goons
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Skyla
rules: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Ditto V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: V Transformation
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may choose a Basic Pokémon V from your discard pile and switch it with this Pokémon. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stick On
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Boss's Orders
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Gym Trainer
rules: Draw 2 cards. If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Rusted Shield
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The Zamazenta V this card is attached to gets +70 HP.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Bird Keeper
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Cara Liss
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Rare Fossil cards and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Piers
rules: Search your deck for an Energy card and a Darkness Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Rose
rules: Attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon VMAX. If you attached any Energy cards in this way, discard your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Yveltal
data.flavorText: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

attacks.name: Amazing Destruction
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.name: Nickit
data.flavorText: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

attacks.name: Instigate
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If they put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, they draw 3 cards.

data.name: Greedent V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stumbling Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Cramorant V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Beak Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Spit Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 160 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Indeedee
data.flavorText: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.

attacks.name: Helping Hand
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Team Yell Towel
rules: Heal 50 damage from both Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Alcremie V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sugary Sprinkles
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sweet Splash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cufant
data.flavorText: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It's also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

data.name: Cramorant VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Jet
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Ball Guy
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 different Item cards that have the word "Ball" in their name, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Professor's Research
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Ball Guy
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 different Item cards that have the word "Ball" in their name, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Poké Kid
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Alcremie VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adornment
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: G-Max Whisk
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
